alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Morris; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 13 at 2:02AM EDT until August 13 at 2:30AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MORRIS...NORTHEASTERN SOMERSET AND NORTHEASTERN MIDDLESEX COUNTIES... At 202 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Victory Gardens to near Chatham to near Edison, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... New Brunswick, Perth Amboy, Morristown, Somerset, Edison, Old Bridge, East Brunswick, Sayreville, North Brunswick, Carteret, Madison, Middlesex, Florham Park, East Hanover, Lincoln Park, Chatham, Boonton, Morris Plains, Riverdale and Far Hills. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 10 and 13. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 35 and 42. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 43 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 9, between mile markers 25 and 43, and between mile markers 46 and 53. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 121 and 134. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
